title: Customizable InfluxDB2 export interval

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I want to export cpu metrics to an InfluxDB Server every 2s, but the default value is set to 10000ms (10s) and and cannot be modified.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Modify InfluxDB export module (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/master/glances/exports/glances_influxdb2.py) to use a new configuration key "export_interval" and init the write api client (lines 71 to 82) with these value (or 10000ms by default).

title: Glances immediate crash on startup in client mode : nf_conntrack_count error

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
**Describe the bug**
installed server on debian proxmox 7.x server, if you run glances in local mode on this machine it runs fine, however if you start it in server mode and try to attach from another machine, client machine app dies immediately with log below. Same occurrence on two different ubuntu machines and a Apple Mac machine (using brew install).

Server:
```
root@pve01:~# glances --version
Glances v3.3.1.1 with PsUtil v5.9.4
Log file: /tmp/glances-root.log
```
Ubuntu client machine debug log shows:

```
user@hp-600-g1-dm-01:~$ glances --version
Glances v3.3.1.1 with PsUtil v5.9.4
Log file: /home/user/.local/share/glances/glances.log
2023-04-10 15:24:32,355 -- CRITICAL -- 'nf_conntrack_count'
2023-04-10 15:24:33,383 -- DEBUG -- cloud plugin - Cannot connect to the OpenStack metadata API http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ami-id: HTTPConnectionPool(host='169.254.169.254', port=80): Max retries exceeded with url: /latest/meta-data/ami-id (Caused by ConnectTimeoutError(<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7f066a148490>, 'Connection to 169.254.169.254 timed out. (connect timeout=3)'))
2023-04-10 15:24:33,440 -- DEBUG -- cloud plugin - Cannot connect to the OpenStack metadata API http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ami-id: HTTPConnectionPool(host='169.254.169.254', port=80): Max retries exceeded with url: /latest/meta-data/ami-id (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7f066a12e250>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 113] No route to host'))
```
Apple mac machine never shows any error after the 'nf_conntrack_count' message:

```
user@graymini ~ % glances --version
Glances v3.3.1.1 with PsUtil v5.9.4
Log file: /Users/user/.local/share/glances/glances.log

2023-04-10 15:49:45,838 -- DEBUG -- Load limit: network_rx_careful = 50.0
2023-04-10 15:49:45,838 -- DEBUG -- Load limit: network_rx_warning = 70.0
2023-04-10 15:49:45,838 -- DEBUG -- Load limit: network_rx_critical = 90.0
2023-04-10 15:49:45,838 -- DEBUG -- Load limit: network_tx_careful = 50.0
2023-04-10 15:49:45,838 -- DEBUG -- Load limit: network_tx_warning = 70.0
2023-04-10 15:49:45,838 -- DEBUG -- Load limit: network_tx_critical = 90.0
2023-04-10 15:49:45,840 -- DEBUG -- Curses interface compatible with 256 colors
2023-04-10 15:49:47,759 -- DEBUG -- Stats updated duration: 1.918477 seconds
2023-04-10 15:49:47,759 -- DEBUG -- Do not export stats during the first iteration because some information are missing
2023-04-10 15:49:47,759 -- DEBUG -- Stats exported duration: 6.2e-05 seconds
2023-04-10 15:49:47,760 -- CRITICAL -- 'nf_conntrack_count'

```
when I reverse the client server setup and try to use the proxmox server a client to the ubuntu machine running glances -s, I get similar errors, but if I run glances in stand alone mode, it seems to run on all machine locally.

```
2023-04-10 15:56:24,824 -- CRITICAL -- 'nf_conntrack_count'
2023-04-10 15:56:32,064 -- INFO -- Stop Glances client browser
2023-04-10 15:56:40,286 -- INFO -- Start Glances 3.3.1.1
2023-04-10 15:56:40,286 -- INFO -- CPython 3.9.2 (/usr/bin/python3) and psutil 5.9.4 detected
2023-04-10 15:56:40,292 -- INFO -- Start GlancesClient mode
2023-04-10 15:56:40,304 -- WARNING -- Wifi lib is not compliant with Python 3, Wifi plugin is disabled
2023-04-10 15:56:40,365 -- WARNING -- Error loading Docker deps Lib. Docker plugin is disabled (No module named 'dateutil')
2023-04-10 15:56:40,368 -- ERROR -- docker plugin - Can not connect to Docker (Error while fetching server API version: ('Connection aborted.', FileNotFoundError(2, 'No such file or directory')))
2023-04-10 15:56:40,904 -- ERROR -- docker plugin - Can not connect to Docker (Error while fetching server API version: ('Connection aborted.', FileNotFoundError(2, 'No such file or directory')))
2023-04-10 15:56:41,534 -- CRITICAL -- 'nf_conntrack_count'
```

Beside this problem, it begs the question of why this application is trying to connect to a public IP address at :
```
http://169.254.169.254/openstack
```
I do not see this documented.

Thanks for your assistance.

title: Tabs in process command line args corrupt the display

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
**Describe the bug**

When a process contains a new line within its command line, glances display is corrupted.
This happens with vscode remote processes, vscode use new lines in processes command lines.

For example, see here in white rectangles:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5435069/230746005-900b4b31-2485-46ed-bef5-846c2170eafc.png)

Topmost rectangle: `trap "exit 0" 15` and `exec $0` are from the docker container command line (which starts with `/bin/sh -c echo Container started`)

Bottommost rectangle: `const fs = require('fs` is from `node -e` process on the previous line.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start Glances without any options
3. Start this command from a console (keep tabs and new lines, use copy paste to ensure they are kept):
```
sh -c '
while true; do true; done
						# const net = require('net');
'
```
5. In Glances, order processes by CPU consumption
6. See the sh process with `# const net = require('net');` corrupting the Glances display

Note: when the command line doesn't have tabs, no display corruption occurs (new lines are replaced by spaces).

**Expected behavior**
The new line characters in the process command line should be replaced with a space to ensure there is no corruption of the display.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Debian Unstable (Debian GNU/Linux 12 (bookworm))
 - Glances Version: Glances v3.3.1.1 with PsUtil v5.9.4
 - Glances logs file
```

title: Glances crashes when used with --export influxdb2

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:

Glances crashes shortly after starting like this:

```shell
glances  --export influxdb2
```

title: AWS EC2 html appear on 2nd line

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
**Describe the bug**
I saw these html text on 2nd line
`AWS EC2 <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head> <meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="Content-Type" /> <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge;chrome=1"> <meta content="no-cache" http-equiv="Pragma" /> <title>Waiting...</title> <script type="text/javascript"> var pageName = '/'; top.location.replace(pageName); </script> </head> <body></body> </html> instance <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head> <meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="Content-Type" /> <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge;chrome=1"> <meta content="no-cache" http-equiv="Pragma" /> <title>Waiting...</title> <script type="text/javascript"> var pageName = '/'; top.location.replace(pageName); </script> </head> <body></body> </html> (undefined)`

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Browser Opera on Win11
```
# git clone https://github.com/nicolargo/glances.git
# cd glances/docker-compose
# docker-compose up -d

```
**Expected behavior**
no html text

**Screenshots**

title: All times displayed in UTC; Container not using TZ/localtime (Docker)

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
**Describe the bug**
All times in Glances are displayed in UTC, not my local time (PST; America/Los_Angeles)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create container using nicolargo/glances:latest-full
2. Connect to glances via IP
3. Times shown are correct, but in UTC (8 hours ahead of PST)

**Expected behavior**
Times should be shown in the local timezone.

**System Info**
OS: Ubunu Server 22.04.2
Docker: 23.0.1
I also use Portainer to manipulate containers occasionally.
Glances container was created via CLI with "--PID host" since Portainer doesn't support setting a value for PID when creating a container. However, recreating/duplicating a container (to change variables) with Portainer keeps the PID setting.

**What I've Done**
I have attempted to change the timezone of my container (via Portainer) with:
1. environment variable TZ set to "America/Los_Angeles"
2. volume map /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
3. volume map /etc/timezone:/etc/timezone:ro
I've tried these alone, and in differing combinations, including setting all at once. No matter what I do, Glances shows UTC time.

This may be something I'm doing wrong, but all my other containers work with either the TZ variable set, or with mapping of /etc/timezone. 

Any/all help/advice is appreciated.

title: Inconsistent data from different mdadm RAID0 arrays

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
I have the :dev docker image installed on 2 docker hosts which have physical RAID Arrays, one is a raid5 array, the other is a raid 0. The data in glances for the raid 5 array correctly identifies it as 5 elements available, 5 in use, but the raid 0 array identifies 2 elemenets available 512k in use ( that's the chunk size )

**To Reproduce**

title: Console formatting permanently messed up when other text printed

When running Glances in a console, if any other text is printed onto that console, the entire screen becomes gibberish until a new Glances session is started.

title: Traceback thrown to do with un-named users
body:
**Describe the bug**
Stacktrace thrown periodically.

Presumably this has to do with processes running under un-named users, such as in Docker containers.

**To Reproduce**
Run a Docker container and then launch glances. Let it run for awhile.

**Expected behavior**
The program does not throw a traceback, and normal operation continues without having to restart it.

title: docker version 3.3.0.4 breaks nvidia gpu sensors

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
**Describe the bug**
Moving from 3.3.0.2 docker image to 3.3.0.4 broke my GPU sensors.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Upgrade to 3.3.0.4

**Expected behavior**
gpu sensors and nvidia-smi works

Latest 3.3.0.4, causes the nvidia-smi command to stop work working, as well see nvml initialization errors in the log. downgrading back to 3.3.0.2 fixes the problem. Looking through the commits its not obvious as to what the issue is.

title: Unable to see docker related information
body:
**Describe the bug**
Unable to see docker related information

**To Reproduce**

1. 
```yaml
services:
  glances:
    image: nicolargo/glances
    container_name: glances
    restart: always
    environment:
      - GLANCES_OPT=-w
    pid: host
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
```
2. 
```bash
docker compose up -d

Enable to see docker related information

title: Since the last update, using Glances with a password fails with a Python error
body:
Hi,
First of all, thanks for your wonderful work with `glances`!

**Describe the bug**

The last docker image seems to fail when using a username/password. Indeed, after updating my glances container, I had the following Python error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/glances", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 176, in main
    core = GlancesMain()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/glances/main.py", line 99, in __init__
    self.args = self.parse_args()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/glances/main.py", line 624, in parse_args
    args.password = self.__get_password(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/glances/main.py", line 776, in __get_password
    password = GlancesPassword(username=username)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/glances/password.py", line 33, in __init__
    self.password_dir = self.local_password_path()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/glances/password.py", line 41, in local_password_path
    return self.config.get_value('passwords',
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_value'
```

I tried to completely remove and reinstall the container but when launching the following command inside the container to choose my username and password, I get the exact same error I pasted above:
`glances -s --username --password` or `glances -s --password`

I tried with both the `lastest-full` and `alpine-latest-full` images and got the exact same issue.

The container runs on a Debian 11 (Bullseye) server with the latest docker version (`Docker version 20.10.20, build 9fdeb9c`).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

With an already existing username/password:

1. Run the Glances container this way: `sudo docker run -d --restart="unless-stopped" -p 61208-61209:61208-61209 -e GLANCES_OPT="-w -u **username** --password" -v **path_to_the_password_file**:/root/.config/glances/**username**.pwd -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro --pid host --name glances nicolargo/glances:alpine-latest-full`
2. Run: `sudo docker logs glances`
3. See error.

Without an already existing username/password:

1. Run the Glances container this way: `sudo docker run -d --restart="unless-stopped" -p 61208-61209:61208-61209 -e GLANCES_OPT="-w" -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro --pid host --name glances nicolargo/glances:alpine-latest-full`
2. Log into it: `sudo docker exec -it glances bash`
3. Launch the command to choose a username and password: `glances -s --username --password`
4. See error.

**Expected behavior**

Being able to use a username/password without the above Python error.

**Screenshots**

NA

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Debian 11 (Bullseye)
 - Glances Version: Glances v3.3.0.1 with PsUtil v5.9.2 (using docker images latest-full/alpine-latest-full)
 - Glances logs file: I can't launch it with a username/password but launching it without them works fine

title: Can't see current time b/c it's beneath the processes list

milestone.title: Glances 3.4.0
milestone.description: Next (last ?) major version for Glances version 3 branch.

body:
Not to be a pain, but in web-server mode, when showing the current processes, the time is displayed at [the very bottom of the list](https://imgur.com/a/IWFzQnB) (as are the log messages). Previously, log messages were show above the list, and it makes it kinda unreadable having to scroll all the way down just to see the time

Is there anyway to change this? Thanks

I have a 16:9 1080p monitor if resolution affects layout at all

_Originally posted by @Cornelius-Figgle in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues/2150#issuecomment-1282031514_

title: csv export dependent on sort order for docker container cpu
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am attempting to export the cpu load of two docker containers to csv (`worker_1`, `worker_2`), which means I need the columns `docker_worker_1_cpu_percent` and `docker_worker_2_cpu_percent`. In my use case, the two workers are load balanced. So for the first request worker_1 is busy for a minute and on the second request it is the same for worker_2.
However, according to the export all load happened in the same container. Lets say the column `docker_worker_2_cpu_percent` is before  `docker_worker_1_cpu_percent` in the csv-file then a simplified table may look like this

| docker_worker_2_cpu_percent | docker_worker_1_cpu_percent |
| --- | --- |
| 0.1208 | 0.1460 |
| 34.8 | 0.1351 |
| 0.1534 | 0.0967 |
| 0.7878 | 0.1244 |
| 0.1364 | 0.1044 |

but the 34.8 value should be under `docker_worker_1_cpu_percent` instead (other values possibly as well, but hard to tell while idling).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start two docker container (need to idle - `sleep` with a long timeout might be an option)
1. Start glances
    1.  I used `glances --disable-process -1 --disable-left-sidebar -t 1 --export-csv-file "./export.csv" --export csv --disable-plugin swap,alert,amps,cloud,connections,core,diskio,folders,fs,gu,ip,irq,memswap,network,ports,processcount,processlist,psutilversion,raid,sensors,smart,uptime,wifi`
    1. but this should be enough `glances --export-csv-file "./export.csv" --export csv`
1. Put load on the first container (e.g. enter the container with `docker exec` and run a program)
1. Put load on the second container
1. Stop glances
1. Examine the csv file - all load will show under only one of the two container while the other idled

**Expected behavior**
The load produced by a container should be placed in the right column referenced by the column name. From the above example:
| docker_worker_2_cpu_percent | docker_worker_1_cpu_percent |
| --- | --- |
| 0.1208 | 0.1460 |
| 0.1351 | 34.8 |
| 0.1534 | 0.0967 |
| 0.7878 | 0.1244 |
| 0.1364 | 0.1044 |

It should work independently from the process sort order (see additional context).

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux Ubuntu 20.04.5
 - Glances v3.3.0.1 with PsUtil v5.9.2 (latest from pip installed in a virtualenv)

**Additional context**
I have narrowed the problem down to the applied sorting in the cli UI. By default process and containers are sorted by cpu, which means the order of the list changes when the workers take turns.
I confirmed this by running it with `glances --sort-processes name` which gave me the expected behavior.

title: AMP: regex with special chars
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/discussions/2139
Originally posted by **G4Zz0L1** September 28, 2022 Hi, I'd like to know if someone has already done this. I'm trying to fetch the number of open ssh connections on the server with the following regex in an AMP: If I use the commented one it doesn't work (and in the debug logs it doesn't show anything useful). The other one is ok, but shows other processes too, which should be excluded. I've tried to check on the python pages for regex, but nothing useful except quoting, and even with that I can't get it work. I'm not a python dev, but I tried something on the python console, and it works fine. Any ideas? Snippet of the config ```yaml [amp_ssh] enable=true #regex=.*sshd:[ a-zA-Z0-9]+@.* regex=.*sshd:.* refresh=30 ``` Python console ```python >>> import re >>> print (re.findall('sshd:[ a-zA-Z0-9]+@','0:00 sshd: g4zz0l1@pts/17')) ['sshd: g4zz0l1@'] >>> print (re.search('sshd:[ a-zA-Z0-9]+@','0:00 sshd: g4zz0l1@pts/17')) ``` Example of a `ps aux | grep "sshd"`, it should get only the third line ``` root 1218 0.0 0.0 8620 5996 ? Ss set26 0:00 sshd: /usr/bin/sshd -D [listener] root 1346931 0.0 0.0 13628 8024 ? Ss 18:25 0:00 sshd: g4zz0l1 [priv] g4zz0l1 1346944 0.0 0.0 13888 5024 ? S 18:25 0:00 sshd: g4zz0l1@pts/17 ```

title: Password files in same configuration dir in effect
body:
This command:
`glances --config /path/to/glances.conf`
should change base directory to look for any glances.pwd file instead of default ~/.config/glances/

title: Web UI truncates the days part of CPU time counter of the process list
body:
Hi @nicolargo
Web UI version of glances doesn't show the correct hours counter in the process list. e.g. if the process CPU time equals 31h20:00 the Web UI shows 7h20:00 (days truncated: 31 - 24 = 7).

**To Reproduce**
To reproduce you can check any process that reached 24h threshold in the process list in the Web UI

**Expected behavior**
CPU time row values match in both console UI and web UI for long-living processes

**Screenshots**
Web UI:

title: Container uptime wrong (timezone bug?)
body: **Describe the bug** I've rebooted the host machine recently and noticed that container uptimes are 2 hours more than the machine uptime. My assumption is that this has to do with my local timezone being 2 hours ahead of GMT. **To Reproduce** ```yaml glances: container_name: glances restart: unless-stopped image: nicolargo/glances:latest-full volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro - ${DATA_DIR}/glances:/etc/glances ports: - 61208:61208 pid: host privileged: true environment: - GLANCES_OPT=-w - PUID=1000 - PGID=1000 - TZ=Europe/Amsterdam ``` **Expected behavior** Container uptime couldn't be longer than the machine uptime **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** N/A **Additional context** If more info is required, let me know

title: --time parameter being ignored for client/server mode
body:
I'm trying to export monitoring data using client/server mode and I want to increase the refresh rate from default 3s to 60s.

I have tried both defining it in the configuration file, also on the client side using `glances -c servername --time 60 --export csv --export-csv-file /home/username/glances_logs/servername.csv` and also on the server side `glances -s --time 60`, but they all are ignored and the result .csv file has information saved every 3s not 60s.

How could this be achieved?

title: glances_ip.py plugin relies on low rating / malicious site domain
body:
**Describe the bug**
The `glances_ip.py` plugin relies on the https://ip.42.pl/raw for retrieving a machines public ip address. 
42.pl is classified as a malicious site which alarms all sort of security related tooling.

https://otx.alienvault.com/indicator/domain/ip.42.pl

This one should probably be removed or replaced with another vendor such as www.icanhazip.com 
https://otx.alienvault.com/indicator/domain/icanhazip.com


**To Reproduce**
Start Glances

**Expected behavior**
No low rating / malicious site should be communicated.

title: Fix: Docker plugin - Invalid Network stats for Containers
body:
**Describe the bug**
The networks stats shown by glances for docker containers always remains at 0b, even when the containers are transferring data

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Have Glances running with the docker plugin an a host with any container that transfers data over a port.
2. Connect to that port and transfer data.
3. See glances still showing 0b for network transfer

**Expected behavior**
Show the proper network usage

**Screenshots**
Current:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52282402/140536038-082cde15-46f2-4edb-bb2c-fced3bcad1a6.png)

Expected:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52282402/140534275-967922c9-c2b1-4332-9bef-b8a3e7f7ab03.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - Glances Version: Glances v3.2.3 with PsUtil v5.8.0
 - Glances logs: [glances.log](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/files/7487131/glances.log)
 - Glances test:
 ```=========================================================
Glances version 3.2.3 with PsUtil 5.8.0
=========================================================

gpu           [OK]    0.00001s []

ports         [OK]    0.00001s [{'host': '10.15.75.241', 'port': 0, 'description': 'DefaultGateway', 'refresh':
processcount  [OK]    0.00001s {'total': 409, 'running': 1, 'sleeping': 284, 'thread': 1848, 'pid_max': 0}
processlist   [OK]    0.00005s key=pid [{'memory_info': pmem(rss=1304514560, vms=11737747456, shared=29544448, 
psutilversion [OK]    0.00002s (5, 8, 0)

raid          [N/A]
sensors       [OK]    0.00001s key=label [{'label': 'Composite', 'value': 51, 'warning': 84, 'critical': 84, 'u
smart         [N/A]
system        [OK]    0.00001s {'os_name': 'Linux', 'hostname': 'ryon', 'platform': '64bit', 'linux_distro': 'A
uptime        [OK]    0.00001s {'seconds': 18441}
wifi          [N/A]
```

The problem is due to a typo in the plugin's `get_docker_network` method

This commit will fix it: https://github.com/RazCrimson/glances/commit/3e7fa12faf2e8bb0392c2604546b19a58d9ed4c8

I also have a couple of typo fixes for comments and minor changes for the docker plugin on this branch:
https://github.com/RazCrimson/glances/tree/docker-plugin-network-stats-typo-bug-fix

Might fix #1918 partially, making this a separate issue as that includes IO stats not being displayed too.
I think I might have found the fix to IOs not being displayed, but am not sure about it, will update that issue shortly.

Is it fine if I make a PR? 😅

title: Influxdb2 via SSL
body:
**Description**
Unable to connect to InfluxDB2

**Version**
Glances v3.2.3.1 with PsUtil v5.5.1

**Logs**
```
2021-10-03 00:55:58,108 -- INFO -- Connected to InfluxDB server version None ((0)
Reason: SSLError
[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate (_ssl.c:1131)
)
2021-10-03 00:56:10,096 -- WARNING -- The retriable error occurred during request. Reason: '[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate (_ssl.c:1131)'.
2021-10-03 00:56:17,977 -- INFO -- Glances stopped (keypressed: CTRL-C)
2021-10-03 00:56:18,140 -- ERROR -- The batch item wasn't processed successfully because: cannot schedule new futures after interpreter shutdown
2021-10-03 00:56:19,801 -- WARNING -- Retrying (WritesRetry(total=4, connect=None, read=None, redirect=None, status=None)) after connection broken by 'SSLError(SSLCertVerificationError(1, '[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate (_ssl.c:1131)'))': /api/v2/write?org=internal&bucket=glances&precision=ns
2021-10-03 00:56:19,903 -- WARNING -- The retriable error occurred during request. Reason: '[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: self signed certificate (_ssl.c:1131)'.
2021-10-03 00:56:23,651 -- INFO -- Glances stopped (keypressed: CTRL-C)
```


**Additional Info**
I see the related bug ([Issue 973](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues/973)) was fix, but it was for InfluxDB version 1.x
I also check the python client for InfluxDB2 ([](https://pypi.org/project/influxdb-client/)) and it also states that it supports a __verify_ssl__ variable.

So I clone the repo, update the file glances/exports/glances_influxdb2.py with the following and build the glances, and tried again, and it works!
```
            client = InfluxDBClient(url=url,
                                    enable_gzip=False,
                                    verify_ssl=False,
                                    org=self.org,
                                    token=self.token)
```

title: No Nvidia GPU info in Webview (still)
body:
**Describe the bug**
Nvidia gpu info is displayed correctly in 'normal' mode, but absent from webview. Previous issues mentioned that it should had been added in 3.1.7, but I'm using 3.2.2 and still don't see it.

**To Reproduce**

1. Start Glances in local mode - nvidia gpu temp and memory info present.
2. Start Glances in webview mode (with -w and --password via systemd service, as same user as in step 1) - no gpu info present.

Webview displaying same info that normal mode does.

title: batinfo not in docker image (and in requirements files...) ?

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
**Describe the bug**
batinfo seems to not be in docker image. I have a laptop (Thinkpad T570) with 3 batteries, including the wireless mouse. batinfo and UPower can show all the information about these batteries, and I'd like them to show up in Glances.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. docker run -it nicolargo/glances python
2. \>\>\> import batinfo
3. "ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'batinfo'"

**Expected behavior**
Looking at [the code](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/c022aa9501c0eb971dafeb2cdcc5e07ce320b0fb/glances/plugins/sensors/glances_batpercent.py) (I'm not too familiar with python though), a missing batinfo seems to be expected in non-linux environments. But this environment (allthough docker) is Linux.

**Screenshots**
I believe I got something working interactively using batinfo
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13216618/128639130-f781fba5-3fe4-4268-8841-c44d6d1c1ab7.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: (Docker 20.10.8 on) Pop OS 20.04 (based on Ubuntu)
 - Glances Version [Glances v3.1.6.2 with PsUtil v5.8.0]
 - Glances logs file:
root@57662d45c772:/glances# tail -10 /tmp/glances-root.log 
2021-08-08 16:41:05,583 -- INFO -- Start Glances 3.1.6.2
2021-08-08 16:41:05,583 -- INFO -- CPython 3.9.4 and psutil 5.8.0 detected
 - Glances test [output of glances --issue] (only available with Glances 3.1.7 or higher)

**Additional context**
I also tried to create a new image based on the latest tag, and just added RUN pip install batinfo. That did not solve the issue, and I do not know what to try next.

title: Glances don't send hostname (tag) to influxdb2
body:
**Describe the bug**
After a lot of investigation I figured out to glances ( 3.2.2 ) don't send hostname field to influxdb ( 2.0.6 )
And it's because of this ( I think ):
https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/develop/glances/exports/glances_influxdb.py#L62
this line missing in:
https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/develop/glances/exports/glances_influxdb2.py#L59
so this piece of code missing: **self.hostname = node().split('.')[0]**
because of that, self.hostname stay None, and influxdb will drop this :D

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start Glances with glances -q --disable-plugin docker --export influxdb2

**Expected behavior**
hostname (tag) in influxdb2

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS:  Ubuntu 20.04 
 - Glances Version 3.2.2

**Additional context**
My config file for influxdb2 =>
$HOME/.config/glances/glances.conf
```
[influxdb2]
host=influxdb.my.net
port=80
protocol=http
org=influxdata
bucket=grafana
token=<token>
```

title: Docker container monitoring only show half command?
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/discussions/1898
Originally posted by **martadinata666** July 16, 2021 Im using glances to monitor my docker installation. But i noticed that the container only show half command. Either it the ENTRYPOINT or CMD. If the container doesn't have ENTRYPOINT it will use CMD and vice versa. Full command should be ENTRYPOINT + CMD ![command](https://res.cloudinary.com/dedyms/image/upload/v1626408056/issues/2021-07-16-105813_1342x675_scrot_c7ojou.png) Is this desired? Like my personal custom image using ENTRYPOINT ```["/usr/bin/tini", "--"]```, and the CMD itself ```["mpd", "--stdout", "--no-daemon", "./mpd.conf"]``` the right glances command column should be ```[ "/usr/bin/tini -- mpd --stdout --no-daemon ./mpd.conf"]```

title: [3.2.0/3.2.1] keybinding not working anymore
body:
Hello,
An user on gentoo forums noticed a strange issue related to keybinding with glances 3.2.0/3.2.1. I noticed the same bug on my Gentoo system and also on Arch Linux with 3.2.0/3.2.1. Keybinding works fine with previous release.
Here is a quote of the user message on the forum as it explains quite well the issue : 

----
So - this is odd - it started a couple of days ago, and I've no idea what to do about this. Glances, which I use a lot. has stopped responding to about half of it's normal commands. Now, I don't expect every keybinding to do something - for instance, I don't run docker, so I don't expect 'D' to produce any docker related output.

However, the following functions are doing nothing either while worked previously.
* (d) show/hide disk IO
* (n) show/hide network stats
* (s) show/hide sensors
* (2) show/hide sidebar
* (l) show/hide alerts
* (F) show/how fs free space

But all the process-list related options, such as the different sorts work, as do commands relating to change what an individual output is producing, such as change Kb to Kbit in the network stats.

It's almost like the sidebar is 'stuck' and I can't change what items it's displaying - though they're updating and I can change some of the output of the existing categories. However, this isn't completely uniform - I can toggle the IRQ stats with 'Q', and show/hide fs stats with 'f' - but that's the only things I can turn on/off on the sidebar.

I've ran glances via the emerged version and via a local install using pip. Both exhibit the same behaviour. Debug mode shows glances is noticing the keypress, but there are no errors or further messages concerning it.

I've removed the config file without any change, so it's not that either. Naturally, my keyboard is working fine. Any ideas??

Thanks

----

title: Docker containers information missing with Docker 20.10.x

body:
**Describe the bug**
Missing information from the "Containers" part: CPU, IOR IOW RX TX

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start Glances with the followings options as a service ExecStart = /usr/bin/glances  -w  -t  10

title: Remove shell=True for actions (following Bandit issue report)
body:
The current Glances version execute actions with the subprocess.Popen function and the shell=True option.

It is an hight security issue: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b602_subprocess_popen_with_shell_equals_true.html#b602-subprocess-popen-with-shell-equals-true

The Popen should now be called with shell=True.

title: "glances --browser" reports "Error while initializing the smart plugin ('NoneType' object has no attribute 'disable_smart')"
body:
**Describe the bug**

After installing glances from Debian 10.8 standard repositories on two of my VMs I wanted to access them with `glances --browser` following https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart.html#central-client. I get a list of the expected VMs but without any data:

```
2 Glances servers available

  Name               LOAD     CPU%    MEM%    STATUS      IP                OS
> vm-seafile            ?        ?       ?       OFFLINE     192.168.1.166     ?
  vm-revproxy        ?        ?       ?       OFFLINE     192.168.1.126     ?
```

When I want to access one of the servers glances reports:

> Connect to vm-seafile Error while initializing the smart plugin ('NoneType' object has no attribute 'disable_smart')     

On both VMs I've opened port `61209`.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Install glances on servers and client:

```
# apt install glances
# apt policy glances
glances:
  Installed: 3.1.0-1+deb10u1
  Candidate: 3.1.0-1+deb10u1
  Version table:
 *** 3.1.0-1+deb10u1 500
        500 http://ftp.de.debian.org/debian buster/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
```
2. Open port `61209` on servers.
3. Configure `[serverlist]` section in `/etc/glances/glances.conf` on client.
4. Start `glances --browser` on client.

**Expected behavior**

I've expected that `glances --browser` would provide LOAD/CPU/MEM data similiar to https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart.html#central-client with the described configuration.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: `Debian 10.8`
 - Glances Version:
 
 ```
 $ glances -V
Glances v3.1.0 with psutil v5.5.1
 ```
 
 - Glances logs file: (sorry I couldn't find the log file location of glances on Debian)

Smart plugin error while start glances as root
body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to start glances as root (not matter what mode, e.g. standalone or web) causes a crash and a python stack trace to be displayed

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start glances either as the root user directly or using sudo

**Expected behaviour**
Glances starts normally

**Actual behaviour**'
Glances crashes with this stack trace:
```

title: Command trimmed incorrectly.

milestone.title: Next releases
milestone.description: Milestones with all next releases issues

body:
Hi,

**Describe the bug**
Incoming ssh connections are displayed in `ps' output like this:

```
sshd: userx@pts/0 (sshd)
sshd: usery@pts/1 (sshd)
sshd: userx@pts/2 (sshd)
sshd: userx@pts/3 (sshd)
```

In glances they are displayed like this:

```
0
1
2
3
```

**To Reproduce**
Ssh into the server.
Watch glances screen.

**Expected behavior**
Useful output.

**Server**
FreeBSD 12.2-RELEASE
Glances 3.1.4
OpenSSH 7.9p1

**Additional context**
I guess you trim all commands up to the last slash, to save space. I think you should make an exception here.
I haven't installed glances on a Linux machine, but I have verified that the `ps' output is the same there, for incoming ssh connections, so I think this is the same on Linux.

Cheers,
  Rob

#### Description

title: Connection to MQTT server fails
body:
The issue reported in #1450 (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues/1450) is still there in 3.1.1b0.

```
[core@homeassistant ~]$ sudo docker run --name=glances --restart=always -p 61208:61208 -e GLANCES_OPT="--disable-process --quiet --export mqtt" -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro -v /srv/automation/glances:/glances/conf:z -v /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro --pid host nicolargo/glances
Connection to MQTT server failed : getaddrinfo() argument 2 must be integer or string 
```
```
[core@homeassistant ~]$ sudo docker run -e GLANCES_OPT="-V" nicolargo/glances
Glances v3.1.1b0 with psutil v5.4.8
```
My glances.conf for mqtt export:

> [mqtt]
> host=localhost
> port=1883
> user=xxxx
> password=yyyy
> topic=homeassistant
> tls=false

I am running Fedora Core OS with SELinux, hence the "z" option on the volume. WebGUI and rest API works just fine if I alter the GLANCES_OPT slightly.

_Originally posted by @petter-b in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues/1450#issuecomment-669252760_

title: Crash on start, caused by natural sort in plugins
body:
#### Description

Steps to reproduce:
- Have a network interface named `foo42` and one named `42foo`.
- Try to open glances
- Crash

The bug is caused by a too simple natural sort implementation in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/develop/glances/plugins/glances_plugin.py#L304, which can't compare things starting with a number against things not starting with a number.

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): Glances v3.1.4.1 with PsUtil v5.7.0
* Operating System (lsb_release -a): Gentoo

#### Logs

The actual output is messed up, here is a cleaned version:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):

File "/usr/lib/python-exec/python3.7/glances", line 11, in <module>
load_entry_point('Glances==3.1.4.1', 'console_scripts', 'glances')()

start(config=config, args=args)

mode.serve_forever()

loop = self.__serve_forever()

File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/standalone.py", line 138, in __serve_forever
ret = not self.screen.update(self.stats, duration=adapted_refresh)

File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/outputs/glances_curses.py", line 962, in update

File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/outputs/glances_curses.py", line 489, in __get_stat_display
max_width=plugin_max_width)

File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/plugins/glances_plugin.py", line 304, in sorted_stats
return sorted(self.stats, key=lambda stat: tuple(map(

TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'str'

title: Can't start server: unexpected keyword argument 'address'
body:
## Description

I installed `glances` on my new Raspberry Pi 4 via

```sh
$ pip3 install 'glances[action,browser,cloud,cpuinfo,docker,export,folders,gpu,graph,ip,raid,snmp,web,wifi]'
```

`glances` itself works as expected but when I launch it in server mode I get following error

```sh
➜  ~ glances -s
Glances XML-RPC server is running on 0.0.0.0:61209
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/pi/.local/bin/glances", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 143, in main
    start(config=config, args=args)
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 108, in start
    mode = GlancesMode(config=config, args=args)
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/server.py", line 229, in __init__
    self.autodiscover_client = GlancesAutoDiscoverClient(socket.gethostname().split('.', 1)[0], args)
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/glances/autodiscover.py", line 215, in __init__
    port=args.port, weight=0, priority=0, properties={}, server=hostname)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'address'
```

But when I disable autodiscover it works: `glances -s --disable-autodiscover`

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): v3.1.4.1 with PsUtil v5.5.1
* Operating System (lsb_release -a):

Distributor ID:	Raspbian
Description:	Raspbian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)
Release:	10
Codename:	buster

title: Unusual characters in cmdline cause lines to disappear and corrupt the display
body:
#### Description
When `cmdline` contains unusual characters, the `glances` display gets corrupted.
Complete lines go missing and some junk is shown on other lines.

title: class AmpsList method _build_amps_list() Windows fail (glances/amps_list.py)
body:
When comparing the .conf regex for an AMP, the regex is almost certain to fail on Windows OS.

The problem lies with the "for c in p['cmdline']:" line within the method. Some processes have a value of 'None' for the key 'cmdline' where a list is expected, meaning the except is tripped (NoneType object is not iterable) and the for loop exits; the regex search has failed. 
In my case it was failing when doing the regex comparison against Desktop Window Manager (dwm.exe) in Windows 10.

Recommend a check of the key p['cmdline'] prior to looping through it (prior to the "for c in p['cmdline']" loop) as that fixed it for me, just a simple:
`if p['cmdline'] is None:
    continue`

title: GPU "proc" showing as 0% in both API and Web UI always
body:
#### Description

**ISSUE:**
The Glances API and Web UI display **GPU proc** value as "**_0_**" and "**_N/A_**", respectively.  I am using an NVIDIA GTX1050ti GPU.

**API URL:**
http://192.168.1.2:61208/api/3/gpu

**Returns:**
[
  {
    "key": "gpu_id",
    "gpu_id": 0,
    "name": "GeForce GTX 1050 Ti",
    "mem": 5.792331695556641,
    "proc": 0,
    "temperature": 26
  }
]

#### Versions
Glances v3.1.4.1 with PsUtil v5.7.0

The only way to see complete GPU information is by running Glances in standalone mode locally on a PC:
![GlancesGPU](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/811008/84607952-f21a6480-ae64-11ea-98b5-02281f11f35b.png)


Maybe, I'm doing something wrong?  Is there a workaround or fix for this?  I'd really like to get this to work properly.

title: glances.conf FS hide not applying
body:
#### Description

For a bug: I've tried numerous ways to attempt to some drives from the file sys section.
This is my current conf:
```
[filesystem]
hide=/boot.*,/snap.*,/dev/loop*,^sd..$
```

whilst this works perfectly for the Disk I/O section adn shows me only sda, sdb and sdc nothing I do seems to have any impact on the file sys table.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1117625/82501440-9377fa00-9af5-11ea-8159-014428f8eee0.png)


#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): latest docker build, not sure how to find version
* Operating System (lsb_release -a): Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS

title: tests using /etc/glances/glances.conf from already installed version
body:
#### Description

test_001_plugins fails like this : 
```
FAIL: test_001_plugins (__main__.TestGlances)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
Check mandatory plugins.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
----------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Traceback (most recent call last):                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
  File "unitest.py", line 88, in test_001_plugins                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
    self.assertTrue(plugin in plugins_list)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
AssertionError: False is not true
```

it happens if one has 3.1.4+ version installed which provides `/etc/glances/glances.conf` with 
```toml
[irq]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
disable=True
```
irq plugin is listed as mandatory in test_001_plugins yet is not loaded during the test because host configuration leaks to the copy being tested/installed and the plugin gets disabled, yet checked for.
 
#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): Glances v3.1.4.1 with PsUtil v5.7.0
* Operating System (lsb_release -a): gentoo

#### Logs

You can also pastebin the Glances logs file (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#logging)

title: Undefined name 'i' in plugins/glances_gpu.py
body:
Before filling this issue, please read the manual (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and search if the bug do not already exists in the database (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues).

#### Description

For a bug: Describe the bug and list the steps you used when the issue occurred.

[flake8](http://flake8.pycqa.org) testing of https://github.com/nicolargo/glances on Python 3.8.1

$ __flake8 . --count --select=E9,F63,F7,F82 --show-source --statistics__
```
./glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py:206:43: F821 undefined name 'i'
                    value = to_fahrenheit(i['value'])
                                          ^
1     F821 undefined name 'i'
1
```
https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/develop/glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py#L206

https://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/user/error-codes.html

On the flake8 test selection, this PR does _not_ focus on "_style violations_" (the majority of flake8 error codes that [__psf/black__](https://github.com/psf/black) can autocorrect).  Instead these tests are focus on runtime safety and correctness:
* E9 tests are about Python syntax errors usually raised because flake8 can not build an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST).  Often these issues are a sign of unused code or code that has not been ported to Python 3.  These would be compile-time errors in a compiled language but in a dynamic language like Python they result in the script halting/crashing on the user.
* F63 tests are usually about the confusion between identity and equality in Python.  Use ==/!= to compare str, bytes, and int literals is the classic case.  These are areas where __a == b__ is True but __a is b__ is False (or vice versa).  Python >= 3.8 will raise SyntaxWarnings on these instances.
* F7 tests logic errors and syntax errors in type hints
* F82 tests are almost always _undefined names_ which are usually a sign of a typo, missing imports, or code that has not been ported to Python 3.  These also would be compile-time errors in a compiled language but in Python a __NameError__ is raised which will halt/crash the script on the user.


For an enhancement or new feature: Describe your needs.

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V):
* Operating System (lsb_release -a):

#### Logs

You can also pastebin the Glances logs file (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#logging)

title: Fix gpu plugin to handle multiple gpus with different reporting capabilities
body:
#### Description

Bug: Computers with multiple Nvidia GPUs may have different level of compute capability and ability to report GPU % and GPU mem % utilization rates. For example GTX 780 with compute capability 3.5 is not able to provide those measurements while RTX 2080 Ti can provide measurements. 


Fix is provided as follows for python 3 against Glances version 3.1.5:
```diff
$ git diff
diff --git a/glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py b/glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py
index 9fd1c292..9f2510fc 100644
--- a/glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py
+++ b/glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py
@@ -226,11 +226,11 @@ class Plugin(GlancesPlugin):
                 id_msg = '{}'.format(gpu_stats['gpu_id'])
                 try:
                     proc_msg = '{:>3.0f}%'.format(gpu_stats['proc'])
-                except ValueError:
+                except (ValueError, TypeError):
                     proc_msg = '{:>4}'.format('N/A')
                 try:
                     mem_msg = '{:>3.0f}%'.format(gpu_stats['mem'])
-                except ValueError:
+                except (ValueError, TypeError):
                     mem_msg = '{:>4}'.format('N/A')
                 msg = '{}: {} mem: {}'.format(id_msg,
                                               proc_msg,
```



#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V):
Glances v3.1.5_DEVELOP with PsUtil v5.7.0

* Operating System (lsb_release -a):
LSB Version:	n/a
Distributor ID:	ManjaroLinux
Description:	Manjaro Linux
Release:	19.0.2
Codename:	Kyria

* Gpustat (```pip install gpustat```)
```bash
$ gpustat 
ryzen6-pc               Mon Apr  6 13:08:57 2020  440.64
[0] GeForce GTX 780     | 42'C,  ?? % |  1201 /  3018 MB | (Not Supported)
[1] GeForce RTX 2080 Ti | 33'C,   0 % |    13 / 11019 MB | gdm(5M) jrin(5M)
```

#### Logs

Glances fails with error with heterogeneous GPUs as other provides values and other does not.

Traceback:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/bin/glances", line 8, in <module>
  sys.exit(main())
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 143, in main
  start(config=config, args=args)
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 112, in start
  mode.serve_forever()
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/standalone.py", line 154, in serve_forever
  loop = self.__serve_forever()
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/standalone.py", line 141, in __serve_forever
  ret = not self.screen.update(self.stats, duration=adapted_refresh)
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/outputs/glances_curses.py", line 962, in update
  self.flush(stats, cs_status=cs_status)
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/outputs/glances_curses.py", line 937, in flush
  self.display(stats, cs_status=cs_status)
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/outputs/glances_curses.py", line 515, in display
  __stat_display = self.__get_stat_display(stats, layer=cs_status)
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/outputs/glances_curses.py", line 488, in __get_stat_display
  ret[p] = stats.get_plugin(p).get_stats_display(args=self.args,
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/plugins/glances_plugin.py", line 801, in get_stats_display
  'msgdict': self.msg_curse(args),
File "/data/p/Cloudnn/cloudnn_model/p3env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/glances/plugins/glances_gpu.py", line 228, in msg_curse
  proc_msg = '{:>3.0f}%'.format(gpu_stats['proc'])

title: Glances 3.1.3: when no network interface with Public address -- Error while initializing the ip plugin ('NoneType' object has no attribute 'split')
body:
Hi glances developers,

Under **CentOS-8.1 (4.18.0-147.5.1.el8_1.x86_64)** found a bug in the stable version of **Glances v3.1.3 with psutil v5.7.0**.

The point of the bug: if there is _no network interface with a public IP address_ in the system, i.e. no access to the Internet (any other network interfaces may be present), running glances will cause an error:
`2020-03-02 15:23:38,010 -- INFO -- Start GlancesStandalone mode`
`2020-03-02 15:23:40,759 -- CRITICAL -- Error while initializing the ip plugin ('NoneType' object has no attribute 'split')`
`2020-03-02 15:23:40,770 -- ERROR -- Traceback (most recent call last):`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/glances/stats.py", line 120, in _load_plugin
    self._plugins[name] = plugin.Plugin(args=args, config=config)`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/glances/plugins/glances_ip.py", line 65, in __init__
    self.public_address = PublicIpAddress().get()`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/glances/plugins/glances_ip.py", line 178, in get
    return ', '.join(set([x.strip() for x in ip.split(',')]))`
`AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'split'`

The bug has 100% repeatability: as soon as the system has a network interface with a public IP address, i.e. Internet access, glances is launched normally without the error above.

I installed the stable version of glances from the Internet with the command `curl -L https://bit.ly/glances | /bin/bash`.

Very thanks for the support.

title: Kafka key name needs to be bytes
body:
https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/3e5ec443cea6edfd705622b4c90da2783ff8bc35/glances/exports/glances_kafka.py#L88

when running glances as follows:

```shell
glances -d -t 5 -C C:\glances\glances.conf --disable-plugin ip --export kafka
```

I would see errors showing up on the local logs like this:

```text
2020-02-05 08:19:14,144 -- ERROR -- Cannot export system stats to Kafka ()
```

I played around with some local python code and kafka-python, and discovered that the `key` argument of the `KafkaProducer.send()` method must be of type byte.

I hacked the glances source locally and changed this:

```python
try:
            self.client.send(self.topic,
                             key=name),
                             value=data)
```

to this:

```python
try:
            self.client.send(self.topic,
                             key=bytes(name, 'utf-8'),
                             value=data)
```

and now my consumer can see the messages flowing.

**update**: description incorrect, see https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues/1569#issuecomment-565742311

title: GPU stats not showing on mobile web view
body: I have the latest version of glances installed and running it in web server mode `glances -w`. If I access the web server from a desktop computer, the GPU stats are visible, but if I access it from a mobile (vertical or horizontal view) they are not displayed. Same is true if I access the web server from a pad in vertical view (stats are not displayed), however in a horizontal view they are.

title: KeyError: b'Rss:' in memory_maps
body:
Before filling this issue, please read the manual (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and search if the bug do not already exists in the database (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues).

#### Description

For a bug: Describe the bug and list the steps you used when the issue occurred.

    > glances -w 
      File "/usr/local/bin/glances", line 11, in <module>
        load_entry_point('Glances==3.1.3', 'console_scripts', 'glances')()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 143, in main
        start(config=config, args=args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/glances/__init__.py", line 108, in start
        mode = GlancesMode(config=config, args=args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/glances/webserver.py", line 41, in __init__
        self.stats.update()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/glances/stats.py", line 234, in update
        self._plugins[p].update()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/glances/plugins/glances_processcount.py", line 73, in update
        glances_processes.update()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/glances/processes.py", line 295, in update
        extended['memory_swap'] = sum([v.swap for v in top_process.memory_maps()])
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/psutil/__init__.py", line 1233, in memory_maps
        it = self._proc.memory_maps()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/psutil/_pslinux.py", line 1513, in wrapper
        return fun(self, *args, **kwargs)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/psutil/_pslinux.py", line 1842, in memory_maps
        data[b'Rss:'],
    KeyError: b'Rss:'


For an enhancement or new feature: Describe your needs.

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V):
    Glances v3.1.3 with psutil v5.6.3
* Operating System (lsb_release -a):

   No LSB modules are available.
   Distributor ID: Ubuntu
   Description:    Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
   Release:        18.04
   Codename:       bionic
   
#### Logs

You can also pastebin the Glances logs file (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#logging)

title: Fix custom refresh time in the web UI
body:
#### Description

The cmd `glances -t 30 -w` was not working because in web UI mode, the time arg was force to 5 seconds.

#### Resume

* Bug fix: yes
* New feature: no
* Fixed tickets: #1521

title: :bug: Fix issue in WebUI with empty docker stats
body: #### Description FIx issue in the Web UI when the docker stats are empty. #### Resume * Bug fix: yes * New feature: no * Fixed tickets: -

title: IP plugin still exporting data when disabled
body:
#### Description
When disabling the IP plugin an empty string is still exported (using influxdb). The IP portion of curses interface is disabled however.

Disabling the plugin through conf file with
```
[ip]
disable=true
```

Running with
`glances -d --export influxdb`

Observed measurement data in influxdb
```
> SELECT * FROM ip ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 5
name: ip
time       history_size host                    ip_disable
----       ------------ ----                    ----------
1570164122 28800        vm15-dev-v2 true
1570164119 28800        vm15-dev-v2 true
1570164116 28800        vm15-dev-v2 true
1570164090 28800        vm15-dev-v2 true
1570164087 28800        vm15-dev-v2 true
```

If enabling ip plugin again (as well as re-appearing in upper right of curses interface):
```
> SELECT * FROM ip ORDER BY time DESC LIMIt 5
name: ip
time       address         gateway       history_size host                    ip_disable mask          mask_cidr public_address
----       -------         -------       ------------ ----                    ---------- ----          --------- --------------
1570164455 157.230.132.137 157.230.128.1 28800        vm15-dev-v2 false      255.255.240.0 20        2604:a880:2:d0::52b7:1
1570164452 157.230.132.137 157.230.128.1 28800        vm15-dev-v2 false      255.255.240.0 20        2604:a880:2:d0::52b7:1
1570164449 157.230.132.137 157.230.128.1 28800        vm15-dev-v2 false      255.255.240.0 20        2604:a880:2:d0::52b7:1
1570164446 157.230.132.137 157.230.128.1 28800        vm15-dev-v2 false      255.255.240.0 20        2604:a880:2:d0::52b7:1
1570164443 157.230.132.137 157.230.128.1 28800        vm15-dev-v2 false      255.255.240.0 20        2604:a880:2:d0::52b7:1
```

#### Versions
Glances v3.1.2 with psutil v5.6.3
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
Release:	18.04
Codename:	bionic

#### Logs
You can see the ip plugin being listed as disabled in log. But still exporting data to influxdb regardless.
https://pastebin.com/F1D2aatA

```
startup
...
2019-10-04 04:23:17,296 -- DEBUG -- ip disabled by the configuration file
...
exporting
...
2019-10-04 04:23:17,707 -- DEBUG -- Export ip stats to InfluxDB
2019-10-04 04:23:17,716 -- DEBUG -- http://HOSTNAME:PORT "POST /write?db=DB HTTP/1.1" 204 0
```

title: [ports] ICMP does not work
body:
#### Description

I use Glances in a Docker container. I'd like to use the `[ports]` section to ping (using ICMP) devices on my local network. If I use a specific port with `port_x_port` (like `Router` on my pic), then everything is fine. If I omit the port number to use ICMP, then `Scanning` can be read, nothing else. Note that there is `Scanning` with `DefaultGateway` as well. 
![](https://i.ibb.co/ngzPTVW/image.png)

#### Versions

* Glances v3.1.1b0 with psutil v5.4.8
* Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)

#### Logs

```
2019-09-06 19:51:03,413 -- INFO -- Start Glances 3.1.1b0
2019-09-06 19:51:03,414 -- INFO -- CPython 2.7.15rc1 and psutil 5.4.8 detected
2019-09-06 19:51:03,418 -- INFO -- Search glances.conf file in /glances/conf/glances.conf
2019-09-06 19:51:03,422 -- INFO -- Read configuration file '/glances/conf/glances.conf'
2019-09-06 19:51:03,473 -- INFO -- Start GlancesWebServer mode

title: Possible typo in glances_influxdb.py
body:
Hello,
it seems to me that at [line 44 of file glances_influxdb.py](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/3286e83ee07fdbfb27fc80e754deccacb7bf6882/glances/exports/glances_influxdb.py#L44) the variable `self.protocol` is misspelled as `self.protocole`.
This prevent glances to connect to InfluxDB; please check it.

title: ip plugin empty interface
body:
## Description
ip plugin has multiple issues with no interfaces defined.

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): Glances v3.1.1 with psutil v5.6.1
* Operating System (lsb_release -a): Gentoo current
#### Logs


tests are running in empty network namespace, probably it triggers the following issues:
```shell-session
running test

Error while initializing the ip plugin ('NoneType' object has no attribute 'split')
```
I believe this is because of https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/commit/f08abbfb6c7841d135ce72972d79dba89f7d11be#diff-351a7e7d7317e2c261dfd3d4d71312bd 

also test fails itself now, it was fine in 3.1.0 under empty network namespace an no interfaces are seen.
3.1.1
```shell-session
ERROR: test_012_ip (__main__.TestGlances)
Check IP plugin.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "unitest.py", line 197, in test_012_ip
    stats_grab = stats.get_plugin('ip').get_raw()
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_raw'
```



3.1.0
```shell-session
==============================================================================
INFO: [TEST_012] Check IP stats
INFO: IP stats: {}
```

affects runtime as well, with no network interfaces glances fails.







easy reproducer

```sh
unshare -n glances

3.1.0 will work
3.1.1 will crash

```python

title: Memory Leak
body: Before filling this issue, please read the manual (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and search if the bug does not already exist in the database (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues). #### Description We are seeing memory indefinitely increase, even with dropping history size to 1 from 28800. I tried to profile memory consumption and realized that memory was being increased inside the update method in stats.py. I made a minor adjustment and commented out self._plugins[p].update_stats_history() and self._plugins[p].update_views(). This helped things, however, I am still seeing memory increase just much slower. I've attached a graph visually showing the memory consumption on an hourly basis, and you can see after I made the change the behavior changed significantly. Memory consumption is increasing most on opensuse 42.3 and debian stretch. Let me know if you need any additional information. #### Versions Glances v3.1.0 with psutil v5.6.1 #### Graph

title: Create an option to set the username to use in Web or RPC Server mode
body:
#### Description

I'm trying to run the glances webserver as a service using NSSM and then use a reverse proxy to connect to it. It all worked well so I tried to get some authentication going by using the --password command but then glances won't run anymore (the service doesn't give any error and it just starts like usually but I can't connect to the webserver anymore). I suspect it just refuses to run because I don't get any logs.

I know I'm doing it right because when I start glances from the cmd it works perfectly... So this seems to be an issue with NSSM. Is there perhaps a workaround or some other way to run the webserver as a service with some authentication? Also is there a way to change the default username?

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): Glances v3.0.2 with psutil v5.4.8
* Operating System (lsb_release -a): Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134

title: Action on port/web and folders plugins is not working
body:
Before filling this issue, please read the manual (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and search if the bug do not already exists in the database (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues).

#### Description

Documentation for port + web checks do not list the syntax for running an action when a check fails. I've tried several permutations (web_N_status_critical_action, web_N_critical_action, web_N_timeout_critical_action....), nothing seems to match up. I see [the alerts are being sent](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/develop/glances/plugins/glances_ports.py#L113) just don't understand how to add an action to them. 

#### Versions

Glances v3.1.0_beta with psutil v5.4.3
Fedora 29

title: Trigger actions without a client connection on Windows
body:
Is it possible to monitor system without a client connection, no matter Standalone, Client/Server or WebServer mode? 
I need to monitor servers without a client to connect to them and make them trigger actions according certain threshold, but don't need an operator to be connected to the servers.
Is it there any parameter or something to do that? I've tried --quite and nothing happens.
OS: Windows 10 HOME and Windows 2012R2, both 64 bit
SW versions: Glances v3.0.2 with psutil v5.4.6

title: ERROR -- Can not grab extended stats (invalid attr name 'num_fds')
body:
I've just installed Glances on Windows 2012R2 64bits server and found out this messaje in the log file.
Before that I tested on a Windows 10 Home laptop and works fine.

I point out that in the Windows server Glances was started in Web Server mode (glances -w) because in client/server mode didn't worked as stated in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues/1157. In Windows 10 it was run in Standalone mode.

What is more, it delays 15 minutes between each log writing, what I find odd (is there any parameter to config this?)

title: Timezone listed doesn’t match system timezone, outputs wrong time
body:
#### Description

In the bottom left of a default glances install, it will output the current date, time, and timezone

Which appears as `2018-10-19 11:02:56 GMT`

However the current time is **11:02:56 BST**, which is _10:02:56 GMT_

```
❯ date --iso-8601=seconds
2018-10-19T11:03:11+0100
````

#### Versions

* Glances & psutil (glances -V): Glances v3.0.2 with psutil v5.4.7
* Operating System (lsb_release -a): Ubuntu 15.10


Having quickly glanced over the source, the change in https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/commit/e3e1aaf303872ec1f4447900a56d1e54c744260d #1249 is incorrect and treats `tzname[0]` as the active timezone, when that isn’t always true.

```
john@joran ~ ❯ python
>>> from time import tzname
>>> tzname
('GMT', 'BST')
```

Following [the suggestions here](https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gw/influxdb.html) I then created a database in InfluxDB called `glances`, created `/etc/glances/glances.conf` containing the suggested contents and  I ran `glances --export-influxdb`. title: Glances shows mdadm RAID0 as degraded when chunksize=128k and the array isn't degraded.
body:
`Glances v2.11.1 with psutil v5.4.3`

I'm observing a very strange behaviour after creating a new and clean RAID0 array using mdadm and six SSDs. Glances shows the following output when the chunk size of the array is 128k:

```
RAID disks   Used Avail
RAID0 md125  128k     2
└─ Degraded mode

title: setup.py should refrence nvidia-ml-py3 to avoid breaking on python3

milestone.title: Glances 3.0
milestone.description: Glances 3.0 roadmap with all issues breaking the API.

body:
#### Description

Related to #1137 and the [documentation](http://glances.readthedocs.io/en/stable/aoa/gpu.html) related to the GPU option.  If you install `nvidia-ml-py3` on python3 it will be overwritten by ` nvidia-ml-py`.  This breaks the nvidia gpu function.

As `nvidia-ml-py3` is listed in: :https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/b016d508f014721823d836486a419482c47e3fd4/optional-requirements.txt#L10

And setuptools is installing `nvidia-ml-py`:
https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/b016d508f014721823d836486a419482c47e3fd4/setup.py#L91

I assume that this is just an issue that is not captured in the unit tests.  I have tested on a few hosts with python2.7 and various versions of python 3 and this simple change solves the issue.  Unfortunately it setuptools does not seem to support python version constraints in this use case.

The issue can be recreated by running:

```sh
$ mkvirtualenv -p python3 foo
...
(foo)$ pip install glances[gpu]
...
(foo)$ glances
```

#### Versions

Python 2:
* Glances v3.0.rc5 with psutil v5.4.6 
* Glances v2.11.1 with psutil v5.4.6

Python 3.6:
* Glances v3.0.rc5 with psutil v5.4.3
* Glances v2.11.1 with psutil v5.4.6

lsb_release:

>Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
>Description:	Ubuntu 18.04 LTS
>Release:	18.04
>Codename:	bionic

#### Logs

[glances-gdahlm.log](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/files/2104826/glances-gdahlm.log)

[glances-pip3.txt](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/files/2104827/glances-pip3.txt)

```
$ python -c "import pynvml"
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/gdahlman/build/python/venvs/glancestest/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pynvml.py", line 1831
    print c_count.value
                ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'. Did you mean print(int c_count.value)?
```

title: Stats updated during export (thread issue)

milestone.title: Glances 3.0
milestone.description: Glances 3.0 roadmap with all issues breaking the API.

body:
Related issue #971

environment
Glances v2.11.1 with psutil v3.4.2
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
Release:        16.04
Codename:       xenial

This happens when the PC load is high.
For example, the data obtained from plugins/glances_system.py is as follows.

Normal
```
{'os_name': 'Linux', 'os_version': '4.4.0-62-generic', 'linux_distro': 'Ubuntu 16.04', 'hostname': 'localhost.localdomain', 'platform': '64bit', 'hr_name': 'Ubuntu 16.04 64bit'}
```

High load
```
{'os_name': 'Linux', 'hostname': 'localhost.localdomain'}
```

This is solved by commenting out the "self.reset()" function of the update function.
https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/blob/c2863629dda28d98a1df126c65c5da3540fbf4a2/glances/plugins/glances_system.py#L108

Perhaps, after clearing the data with "self.reset()", I think that I output it to CSV before getting it again.
In addition, this problem is not limited to the system plug-in, it may occur in all plug-ins.

title: Possible wrong values printed on chart network interfaces transmission speeds?

milestone.title: Glances 3.0
milestone.description: Glances 3.0 roadmap with all issues breaking the API.

body:
I've just transferred a bunch of big files over a 1Gb network on an interface named `eno2`. The overall file size was 176GB and many files are over 10GB in size, so each files took from several seconds to minutes in order be transferred. 

Glances' GUI correctly reported the real-time transfer speed (`Tx/s`) at values near 1Gb/s (9xxMb/s), **BUT** the generated graph shows different values for the same interface, so I was wondering if this is a known error. In particullary, speed is plotted at a stady value of about 300Mb/s (37.5MB/s) with an isolated small peak at about 1200Mb/s (150MB/s). This is totally wrong because I was monitoring the speeds from my Qnap NAS, which correctly reported about 928Mb/s (116MB/s) - see the graph below:

![schermata 2018-03-15 alle 12 36 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5948581/37461229-eb9f967e-284d-11e8-8074-d8ffb395ce54.png)

I run Glances issueing this command:
```glances -t 1 --export-graph --path-graph /var/www/glances/ --disable-hddtemp --disable-sensors --disable-cloud --disable-wifi```

Here's the graph generated by Glances (look at the first chart):
![glances_network_tx](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5948581/37460965-2757d5d8-284d-11e8-8251-c587705ce6e0.png)

milestone.title: Glances 3.0
milestone.description: Glances 3.0 roadmap with all issues breaking the API.

body: #### Description On the web ui, the route `/` can define the `refresh_time` on the webap. But if we set a negative value (ie: `http://localhost:61208/-1`). We flood the server to refresh The webapp should check the refresh delay and if that is < 1s, set to 1s or 5s. #### Versions * Glances (glances -V): latest develop version * PSutil (glances -V): * Operating System (lsb_release -a): #### Logs You can also pastebin the Glances logs file (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#logging)

title: autostart on AWS ?
body:
#### Description

I want the simplest route to autostarting 

    glances -s

and unfortunately the **AWS Amazon** default instances do not seem to have the [systemd](https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/wiki/Start-Glances-through-Systemd) `sudo systemctl` command.

#### Partial solution

I am trying to wiggle myself into the `init.d` labyrinth, but so far no full success. Using a script adapted from [moumoul/scripting/initd/glances](https://github.com/moumoul/scripting/blob/master/initd/glances) --> [my version](https://gist.github.com/drandreaskrueger/4ba370787a2bc5bd9a107958d093b357) ... like this:

    sudo cp glances /etc/init.d/
    sudo ln -s /etc/init.d/glances /etc/rc.d/rc3.d/S97glances
    sudo reboot

and yes it does something, PID and LOCK file are created, but after rebooting, I do not see glances with

    ps aux | grep glances

#### Odd:

Strangely, when starting it manually as a user, it (kind of) works:

```
$ /etc/init.d/glances start

touch: cannot touch ‘/var/lock/subsys/glances’: Permission denied
$ Glances XML-RPC server is running on 0.0.0.0:61209
Announce the Glances server on the LAN (using 172.31.2.99 IP address)

$ ps aux | grep glances
ec2-user  3342  0.0  0.3 115612  3056 pts/0    S    16:14   0:00 /bin/sh /etc/init.d/glances start
ec2-user  3345  0.0  0.2 113096  2748 pts/0    S    16:14   0:00 /bin/bash -c ulimit -S -c 0 >/dev/null 2>&1 ; /home/ec2-user/env/glances/bin/glances -s
ec2-user  3346  2.2  2.9 545096 29600 pts/0    Sl   16:14   0:00 /home/ec2-user/env/glances/bin/python2.7 /home/ec2-user/env/glances/bin/glances -s
ec2-user  3378  0.0  0.2 110468  2044 pts/0    S+   16:14   0:00 grep --color=auto glances
```

I think I am almost there ... but I already have a big virtual bump on my head due to running against the same invisible wall for too long now ;-)
    
any idea?

title: FreeBSD blackhole bug

milestone.title: Glances 3.0
milestone.description: Glances 3.0 roadmap with all issues breaking the API.

body:
Hi all.
Using Glances on FreeBSD but during optimizing my server I found a problem with glances and system option like blackhole.

So, glances works well, until I will execute commands (or add to sysctl) the following:
sysctl -w net.inet.tcp.blackhole=2
sysctl -w net.inet.udp.blackhole=1

After doing it, glances just loading, and nothing more happens. Until I press ctrl+c. I waited for about 5 minutes.
If I switch those variables back to 0 (blackholes), it again works well.



Versions:
glances --version
Glances v2.11.1 with psutil v5.4.0
python --version
Python 2.7.13

FreeBSD xxx.xxx.com 10.3-RELEASE-p20 FreeBSD 10.3-RELEASE-p20 #0: Wed Jul 12 03:13:07 UTC 2017     root@amd64-builder.daemonology.net:/usr/obj/usr/src/sys/GENERIC  amd64

Before filling this issue, please read the manual (https://glances.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and search if the bug do not already exists in the database (https://github.com/nicolargo/glances/issues).

I am using glances 2.7.1.1-2  on our debian-stretch system. 
when running glances -w or glances -s, got the error "ssl.SSLError: ("bad handshake: Error([('SSL routines', 'tls_process_server_certificate', 'certificate verify failed')],)",)"

run- glances

run- glances -w
